CatDescriptText: Mrs. Pauline Perkins, housewife, of 2241 Hallett St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that they would oppose a raise in taxes for that purpose. In fact, they should vote to increase taxes if they want better schools for their children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pauline Perkins, wearing dark varsity style jacket with snap closures, knit collar and cuffs, and light colored trim on pockets and shoulders, light colored knit gloves with decoration, and patterned head scarf, carrying open umbrella and paper bag with leopard print, standing in front of brick building
